calculator
Class GUI

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          java.awt.Window
              java.awt.Frame
                  javax.swing.JFrame
                      calculator.GUI
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
public class GUI
extends javax.swing.JFrame
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener

A GUI for the Calculator class, to parse functions input as Strings by the user at an optionally specified x-value.

Hierarchy of Components:


  contentPane         : the main pane, from getContentPane()

    info_panel        : contains info_label[0:3]

      info_label[0:3] : 4 labels; containts information, such as using constants or math functions

    input_panel       : contains all input labels and textfields

      f_label         : label for function input: FX_STR variable

      f_panel         : contains f_input textfield

        f_input       : textfield for inputting the function to be parsed

      x_label         : label for x-value input: X_STR variable

      x_panel         : contains x_input textfield

        x_input       : textfield for inputting the x-value to be parsed at

    button_panel      : contains eval_button

      eval_button     : button to begin parsing the function String at an x-value

    result_panel      : contains result_label

      result_label    : displays the result of parsing

Author:
Mike Facelle
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

GUI

Method Detail

actionPerformed

public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent ev)
If ActionEvent source is eval_button (the only button in this GUI), then this will create a new Parser object, supplying it with the String from f_input and the double-value of the String from x_input. Then it will perform the evaluate() method from the Parser class.
This method will then set the text String in result_label to the String equivalent of the result from evaluate() If an InvalidParseException is thrown by evaluate(), then it will set the text of result_label to the error message generated by evaluate().

Specified by:
actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener
